reviews.review: Great professor. He's super funny and makes the course material pretty interesting. The workload as far as assignments go is pretty light, just a small thing every week before discussions. There are a lot of readings, so that is a factor I'd keep in mind, but I'd say it's pretty much worth it, the reading itself is interesting enough and even if you don't do all of it - if you go to class, he'll talk about it in depth.

name: RELS170
title: Greek and Roman Mythology
description: Cross-listed with CLAS170. Credit only granted for: CLAS170 or RELS170. Additional information: This course cannot be taken for language credit. An introduction to the mythology of ancient Greece and Rome. This course is particularly recommended for students planning to major in foreign languages, English, history, the fine arts, or journalism. Taught in English.
